channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What a White House Report Says (and Doesn’t Say) About Pesticides and Health
item.description: The report on children’s health calls attention to glyphosate and atrazine, which are widely used on U.S. crops.

item.title: Trump Administration Halts Harvard’s Ability to Enroll International Students
item.description: The move was a major escalation in the administration’s efforts to pressure the college to fall in line with President Trump’s demands.

item.title: Democrats seek to insulate security for judges from executive branch politics
item.description: Recent critiques of judges from the Trump administration have prompted fears the Marshals could be caught in the middle of a power struggle and forced...

item.title: Forecasters predict above-average hurricane season again
item.description: Forecasters expect 13 to 19 storms to form in the Atlantic between June 1 and the end of November. At least 6 of those are forecast to be full-blown h...

item.title: Takeaways From the White House’s ‘Make America Healthy Again’ Report
item.description: The report echoes many of Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s talking points on ultraprocessed foods and vaccines, but with some notable omission...

item.title: Small Plane Crash in San Diego Kills at Least 2, Officials Say
item.description: The crash of the plane, a Cessna Citation jet, also injured eight other people and destroyed several homes in the Tierrasanta neighborhood.

item.title: Community groups say Louisiana is trying to stop them from monitoring air pollution
item.description: For community groups to allege violations of environmental rules, a state law says groups have to use federally-approved testing equipment, and it set...

item.title: Father of accused Ga. school shooter has been arrested. Both are to appear in court
item.description: Questions remain over this week's school shooting that killed two students and two teachers, as the father of the 14-year-old shooter is charged with ...

item.title: Deadlocked Supreme Court Rejects Bid for Religious Charter School in Oklahoma
item.description: In a 4-to-4 decision, the court upheld a ruling by the Oklahoma Supreme Court that blocked the school.

item.title: Here's what we know about the 2 Israeli embassy staffers killed in Washington, D.C.
item.description: Two staff members of the Israeli Embassy in Washington, D.C. were killed in a shooting after attending an event a Jewish museum. A suspect shouted "fr...

item.title: Shooting Outside D.C. Jewish Museum Is Part of Global Surge in Antisemitism
item.description: Anti-Jewish attacks have increased since the Oct. 7 attacks by Hamas in 2023, and have remained high during Israel’s bombardment of Gaza, according to...

item.title: Forest Loss Around the World Hit a Record in 2024
item.description: Forests around the world disappeared at a rate of 18 soccer fields every minute, a global survey found. Fires accounted for nearly half of the losses.

item.title: Israelis, Stunned by D.C. Shooting, Fear Backlash Over Gaza War
item.description: Political leaders pointed fingers at each other, suggesting that their opponents were responsible for a rise in antisemitism and criticism of Israel.

item.title: Simon Mann, Mercenary Who Sought to Overthrow African Ruler, Dies at 72
item.description: After Eton and a successful career in the British Army, he became the go-to guy for military coups, he said. The rewards (and risks) were enormous.

item.title: Who Is Julius Malema, the South African Politician in the White House Video?
item.description: President Trump surprised a South African delegation with a video montage of apartheid-era chants from Mr. Malema.
